column6: Tested By:-Aleena Paul
Tested Date:-17-09-25
Module Name:-Login Page

column3: Test Description
column4: Test Procedure
column6: Expected Result
column7: Actual Result

column3:
Check whether the user can log in
by entering valid credentials. Verify that 
the system redirects the user to the 
Products page successfully.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter standard_user in username
3. Enter secret_sauce in password
4. Click Login
column6:
The user should be redirected to the Products
page after entering valid credentials. The page 
must load properly with all elements visible.
column7:
The login was successful, and the user was redirected 
as expected. The Products page loaded correctly 
without any errors.

column3:
Check whether the problem_user is 
able to log in using valid credentials. 
Verify that after login, the system 
redirects the user to the Products page.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter problem_user in username
3. Enter secret_sauce in password
4. Click Login
column6:
The problem user should also be able to log in
 successfully using valid credentials. The system 
must redirect the user to the Products page without
 issues.
column7:
The user logged in without any errors, as expected.
 The Products page was displayed correctly after login.
 All page elements loaded properly and navigation 
worked as intended.

column3:
Check whether the performance_glitch_
The user can log in using valid 
credentials.Confirm that the user is 
redirected to Products page after login.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter performance_glitch_user in
    username
3. secret_sauce in password ,Click Login
column6:
The performance_glitch_user should be able to log
 in with valid credentials. The login process may
 take slightly longer than normal. The user should 
still be redirected successfully to Products page.
column7:
The login took a bit longer, but the user landed on the 
Products page. The page loaded correctly without any 
functional errors. All items and navigation elements
were displayed as expected.

column3:
Check whether error_user can login 
successfully.Verify that the user is 
redirected to the Products page after
login.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter error_user in username
3. Enter secret_sauce in password
4. Click Login
column6:
Error_user should login successfully; no error 
messages expected.The Products page should be 
displayed after successful login.All items and menus
 should load properly without glitches.
column7:
The user logged in with valid credentials.
The Products page opened as expected after login.
Some UI inconsistencies were noticed, but functionality 
worked.

column3:
Check if the visual_user can log in with
correct details.Make sure no error
message is shown during login.Confirm
that the user is taken to  Products page.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter visual_user in username
3. Enter secret_sauce in password
4. Click Login
column6:
The visual_user should log in without any problems.
After login, the Products page should open 
normally.All products and menus should appear 
clearly without mistakes.
column7:
The user logged in successfully with valid details.
After logging in, the Products page was displayed 
properly. All items and menus appeared as expected 
without problems.

column3:
Check if the Enter key can be used to 
log in with valid details.Ensure it works
 the same as clicking the Login button.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter valid credentials
3. Press Enter
column6:
Login should be successful when Enter is pressed.
The user should be redirected to the Products page.
All items, buttons, and menus should appear 
correctly on the page.
column7:
Login worked by pressing the Enter key with valid 
credentials.The user was redirected to the Products 
page as expected.The page loaded properly without any 
errors or delays.

column3:
Check whether the password entered in
the field is masked .Ensure that typed
Characterss are not visible as plain 
text.
column4:
1.Open the login page.
2.Enter a valid username.
3.Enter a valid password.
4.Press the Enter key.
column6:
Password should be displayed as bullets  while
typing.The field should not reveal any typed
characters.Login should still work properly after 
entering the password.
column7:
The password field masked all typed characters with
 bullet .Typed characters were not visible on the screen.
Login worked normally after entering the masked 
password.

column3:
Check whether the login button become
active after entering valid details.Ensure
the button is clickable once username
and password are entered.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter valid username
3. Enter valid password
4.click login button
column6:
Login button should be enabled after entering valid
 username and password.The user should be able 
to click the button to log in.The Products page
 should open successfully after clicking.
column7:
The login button was enabled after entering credentials.
The user clicked the button and logged in successfully.
The Products page loaded without any errors or delays.

column3:
Check whether placeholders are
displayed in fields. Ensure that the 
placeholder text is meaningful  guides 
the user about the expected input.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Inspect username field
3. Inspect password field
column6:
Username and password fields should show 
placeholder text (“Username” and “Password”). 
The placeholder text should be clearly visible and 
guide the user about the expected input.
column7:
Placeholders were displayed correctly in the UI, 
appearing in the appropriate fields. They were 
clearly visible.

column3:
check whether the login page loads 
within 3 seconds. The page should load 
completely without any missing
elements or broken links.
column4:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Measure page load time
3.click login button
column6:
The login page should load quickly, within 3 
seconds. All elements, including input fields, buttons
and text, should appear correctly without delays.
column7:
Page loaded fast enough within the expected time. All 
elements were displayed correctly, and the user could 
interact with the page immediately without any delay.

column3:
Check whether the locked-out user
cannot log in. The system should 
prevent access for this user even with 
valid credentials.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter locked_out_user in username
3. Enter secret_sauce in password
4. Click Login
column6:
Locked_out_user should not be able to log in; an 
error message is expected. The system must 
prevent access even with valid credentials.
column7:
Error displayed: ‘Sorry, this user has been locked out.’ 
The message is clear, visible, and prevents the 
locked-out user from accessing the application.

column3:
Check whether system shows error for
 blank username & password. The login
 should be prevented if either or both
 fields are empty.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Leave both fields blank
3. Click Login
column6:
Blank username and password should trigger an 
error: ‘Username is required.’ The system must 
prevent login until the username is entered.
column7:
System correctly displayed the error message. The 
message was clear, visible, and prevented the user
 from logging in until valid credentials were entered.

column3:
Check whether system shows error for
 blank password. The login should be
 prevented if the password field is empty.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter standard_user in username
3. Leave password blank
4. Click Login
column6:
Blank password should trigger error: ‘Password is 
required.’ The system must prevent login until the
password is entered.
column7:
The system showed the appropriate error message. The 
message was clear, visible, and prevented the user from
logging in until a valid password was entered.

column3:
Check whether system shows error for
 blank username. The login should be 
blocked if the username field is empty.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Leave username blank
3. Enter password
4. Click Login
column6:
Blank username should trigger error: ‘Username is 
required.’ The system must prevent login until the 
username is entered.
column7:
System displayed the correct error message. The 
message was clear, visible, and successfully prevented
 the user from logging in until the username was provided.

column3:
Check whether system shows error for
 wrong password. The login attempt
 should be rejected if the entered
 password is incorrect.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter standard_user in username
3. Enter wrongpass in password
4. Click Login
column6:
Wrong password with valid username should show:
‘Username and password do not match.’ The 
system must block access and ensure the use
remains on the login page.
column7:
Error message displayed as expected. The message
 was clear, visible, and correctly prevented access until
 valid credentials were entered.

column3:
Check whether system shows error for
 wrong username. The login attempt 
should be rejected if the entered
 username does not exist.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter wronguser in username
3. Enter secret_sauce in password
4. Click Login
column6:
Wrong username with valid password should show:
 ‘Username and password do not match.’ The 
system must block the login attempt and ensure
 the user stays on the login page.
column7:
Error message displayed as expected. The message
 was clear, visible, and correctly prevented the user 
from logging in with an invalid username.

column3:
Check whether SQL injection attempt is
 blocked. The system should prevent 
any malicious input from being executed
 as a database command.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter ' OR 1=1;-- in username
3. Enter ' OR 1=1;-- in password
4. Click Login
column6:
SQL injection attempt should fail and displayn
generic error: “Username and password do not 
match.”
column7:
System rejected the input and displayed the error
 correctly. The SQL injection attempt was blocked, no 
sensitive data was exposed, and the user could not gain 
unauthorized access.

column3:
Check whether the system rejects
 special characters. The login should be
 blocked if the username or password
 contains invalid symbols.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter @@@@ in username
3. Enter #### in password
4. Click Login
column6:
Special characters in username/password should
trigger an error message. The system must prevent
login attempts with invalid symbols and clearly 
inform the user to use only allowed characters.
column7:
System blocked invalid input and showed an error. The 
user could not proceed with usernames.or passwords 
containing special characters, ensuring that the system
 enforces input validation correctly.

column3:
Check whether system blocks long
username. The login should be 
prevented if the username exceeds the
maximum allowed characters.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter 100+ character username
3. Enter password
4. Click Login
column6:
Username longer than allowed characters should 
trigger an error. The system must prevent login 
attempts with excessively long usernames.
column7:
System displayed an error or blocked input. The user
 could not proceed with a username longer than 
allowed, ensuring that the system correctly enforces
 input length restrictions.

column3:
Check whether system enforces case
sensitivity. The login should fail if the
username or password case does not
match exactly.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter Standard_User in username
3. Enter Secret_Sauce in password
4. Click Login
column6:
Username/password with wrong case
 (case-sensitive) should fail. The system must
 reject login attempts if any letter in the username.
column7:
System rejected login with case mismatch and showed 
an error. The error was clearly visible, and the user 
could not access the application until the correct 
case-sensitive credentials were entered.

column3:
Check whether the  locked_out_user is
able to log in using valid credentials. 
Verify that after login, the system 
redirects the user to the Products page.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter locked_out_user in username
3. Enter secret_sauce in password
4. Click Login
column6:
Error message: 'Sorry, this user has been locked
out.' Login should be blocked. The message must 
be clear and visible, preventing the locked-out user 
from accessing any part of the application.
column7:
User cannot log in, and error message is displayed. 
The system successfully prevented access for the
 locked-out account.

column3:
Check whether pressing Tab navigates 
through fields correctly. Ensure the
focus moves sequentially from one
input field to the next.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Press Tab key
3. Move from username ,password ,login
4. Verify focus order
column6:
Focus should move logically through input fields
and buttons using the Tab key. Each field and 
interactive element must be reachable in the correct
order.
column7:
Tab navigation worked correctly. Focus moved 
sequentially through all input fields and buttons. No
 elements were skipped or inaccessible via keyboard.

column3:
Check whether the login page logo is
displayed. Ensure the logo is visible, 
properly aligned, and clearly rendered.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Locate page logo
3. Verify visibility
4. Ensure logo is clear
column6:
Logo should be visible and positioned correctly on 
the login page. It must be clearly rendered without 
distortion or overlap with other elements. The logo 
should match the expected branding.
column7:
Logo displayed clearly at the top of the page. It was 
properly positioned and aligned. No distortion or visibility
 issues were observed.

column3:
Check whether password reveal (eye
 icon, if available) works. Ensure that
 clicking the icon toggles the password
 field between masked and visible text.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter password
3. Click “eye” icon
4. Verify password becomes visible
column6:
Clicking the reveal icon should toggle password
 visibility correctly. The password must switch
 between masked and plain text instantly. The
 functionality should work consistently for all users.
column7:
Password reveal toggled successfully. The
 password switched correctly between masked and
 visible text. Functionality worked consistently without 
errors.

column3:
Check whether copy-paste is possible
 in the password field on the login page.
 Ensure that users can paste a
 password from the clipboard if allowed.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Copy text from another field
3. Paste into password
4. Attempt login
column6:
System allowed pasting into the password field.
 Users could successfully paste text from the
 clipboard. Functionality worked as expected
 without errors.
column7:
Paste attempt allowed. Text was successfully inserted
 into the password field from the clipboard. No 
restrictions prevented the action.

column3:
Check whether login page text is
 readable in high contrast mode. Ensure
 that all labels, placeholders, and
 buttons remain visible.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enable high contrast mode
3. Verify text visibility
4. Attempt login
column6:
Text, buttons, and links should remain visible and 
readable in high contrast mode. All elements must 
maintain sufficient contrast against the background. 
No content should become difficult to see.
column7:
Text and buttons were clearly visible; login worked as 
expected. All elements remained readable in high 
contrast mode. No issues were observed during 
interaction.

column3:
Check whether login form fields have
 proper labels. Ensure that each input 
field (e.g., username and password)
 has a visible and descriptive label.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Inspect username and password fields
3. Verify label presence
4. Attempt login
column6:
All input fields should have proper, accessible label
 for screen readers. Labels must clearly describe 
 purpose of each field and be correctly linked to 
their respective inputs.
column7:
Labels present and accessible; login worked correctly. 
Each input field was properly labeled, supporting screen
 readers. No accessibility issues were observed.

column3:
Check whether the login page shows
 the correct error for invalid credentials.
 Enter incorrect username and/or 
password.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter invalid username/password
3. Click Login
4. Verify error message
column6:
System should show an appropriate error message
 for invalid credentials. The message must be 
clearly visible, concise, and inform the user of the
 login failure.
column7:
Error message displayed clearly; user was prevented 
from logging in. The message accurately indicated 
invalid credentials. No sensitive information was 
exposed.

column3:
Check login with a password exceeding
 the maximum allowed length. Enter a
 password longer than the defined limit
 and verify the system’s response.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Enter valid username
3. Enter 100+ character password
4. Click Login
column6:
System should prevent login and show an error for
 password length exceeded. Users must  informed 
that the password exceeds the allowed limit.
column7:
Error displayed correctly; input was rejected. The
 system prevented login with an overly long password. 
No unexpected behavior was observed.

column3:
Check whether the login page handles
 browser zoom correctly. Verify that all
 elements—including input fields, 
buttons, labels, and logos remain visible.
column4:
1. Open login page
2. Zoom in and out (Ctrl + / Ctrl -)
3. Verify layout
4. Attempt login
column6:
Page should remain functional, and layout should
 adjust without overlapping elements. All input fields,
 buttons, and labels must remain visible and 
usable at different zoom levels.
column7:
Login page remained usable; no layout issues occurred 
with zooming; login worked as expected. All elements
 stayed properly aligned and functional.

column3:
Check whether the look and feel of the
 buttons on the Login page are
 user-friendly without any confusion.
column4:
1. Open Swag Labs Login page. 
2. Inspect Login, Reset, and other buttons
3. Observe size, color, label clarity,
4. Attempt to click buttons and navigate.
column6:
Buttons should be clearly visible, labeled correctly, 
consistent in style, and intuitive to use without
 confusing the user.
column7:
Buttons appear inconsistent: colors and sizes differ; 
 effects unclear.
